verses.plain: I said, I will take heed to my ways, that I sin not with my tongue: I will keep my mouth with a bridle, while the wicked is before me.

tokens.t: I said, I will take heed to my ways, that I sin not with my tongue: I will keep my mouth with a bridle, while the wicked is before me.

verses.plain: I was dumb with silence, I held my peace, even from good; and my sorrow was stirred.

tokens.t: I was dumb with silence, I held my peace,
from good; and my sorrow was stirred.

verses.plain: My heart was hot within me, while I was musing the fire burned: then spake I with my tongue,

tokens.t: My heart was hot within me, while I was musing the fire burned:
spake I with my tongue,

verses.plain: LORD, make me to know mine end, and the measure of my days, what it is; that I may know how frail I am.

tokens.t: , make me to know mine end, and the measure of my days, what it
I may know how frail I

verses.plain: Behold, thou hast made my days as an handbreadth; and mine age is as nothing before thee: verily every man at his best state is altogether vanity. Selah.

tokens.t: Behold, thou hast made my days
an handbreadth; and mine age
as nothing before thee: verily every man at his best state
altogether vanity. Selah.

verses.plain: Surely every man walketh in a vain shew: surely they are disquieted in vain: he heapeth up riches, and knoweth not who shall gather them.

tokens.t: Surely every man walketh in a vain shew: surely they are disquieted in vain: he heapeth up
, and knoweth not who shall gather them.

verses.plain: And now, Lord, what wait I for? my hope is in thee.

tokens.t: And now, Lord, what wait I for? my hope
in thee.

verses.plain: Deliver me from all my transgressions: make me not the reproach of the foolish.

tokens.t: Deliver me from all my transgressions: make me not the reproach of the foolish.

verses.plain: I was dumb, I opened not my mouth; because thou didst it.

tokens.t: I was dumb, I opened not my mouth; because thou didst

verses.plain: Remove thy stroke away from me: I am consumed by the blow of thine hand.

tokens.t: Remove thy stroke away from me: I am consumed by the blow of thine hand.

verses.plain: When thou with rebukes dost correct man for iniquity, thou makest his beauty to consume away like a moth: surely every man is vanity. Selah.

tokens.t: When thou with rebukes dost correct man for iniquity, thou makest his beauty to consume away like a moth: surely every man
vanity. Selah.

verses.plain: Hear my prayer, O LORD, and give ear unto my cry; hold not thy peace at my tears: for I am a stranger with thee, and a sojourner, as all my fathers were.

tokens.t: Hear my prayer, O
, and give ear unto my cry; hold not thy peace at my tears: for I
a stranger with thee,
a sojourner, as all my fathers

verses.plain: O spare me, that I may recover strength, before I go hence, and be no more.

tokens.t: O spare me, that I may recover strength, before I go hence, and be no more.

footnotes.text: my mouth…: Heb. a bridle, or, muzzle for my mouth
how…: or, what time I have here
his…: Heb. that which is to be desired in him to melt away
